metadata.title: CVE-2022-26373 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Non-transparent sharing of return predictor targets between contexts insome Intel(R) Processors may allow an authorized user to potentially enableinformation disclosure via local access.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-26373` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1060-dell300x - 4.15.0-1060.65
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1127-raspi2 - 4.15.0-1127.135
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1145-snapdragon - 4.15.0-1145.155
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '4.15.0-204.215').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'replaced by linux-hwe-5.4').
linux-hwe-5.4 package in bionic is affected. An update containing the fix has been completed and is pending publication (note: '5.4.0-128.144~18.04.1').
